text:
7, Fab. 1991 Se QA

INBIFO Institut fOr biologische Forschung - Kéin
FORMSKW91 EROMWO OBJECT.WM

GENERAL OBJECTIVES AND SPECIFICATIONS
1.1 Objective _ —

‘The objective of the intended study is to characterize (apparent
molecular weight, isoelectric point, antigenic sites) the
CYTOKERATINS of freshly isolated RNE and RTE cells, of RNE and RTE
cells in primary culture, and of a chemically transformed, focus-
derived RTE cell line by gel electrophoresis and immunoblotting.

1.2 Specifications

The intended investigation will provide basic information with
regard to the degree of homology between human and rat
cytokeratins - a class of intermediate filament proteins which
represent important markers of epithelial cell differentiation and
possible transformation-related changes.

The xesult may help to select specific antibodies as a tool for
further immunohistological examinations, such as concerning the
alterations that accompany metaplastic changes in the larynx, the
labeling of RTE cells in the chick embryo skin invasion assay, or
the dedifferentiatiom of RTE and RNE cells in vitro.

summary: The objective of the intended study is to characterize (apparent.molecular weight, isoelectric point, antigenic sites) the Cytokeratins of freshly isolated RNE and RTE cells. The xesult may help to select specific antibodies as a tool for further immunohistological examinations, such as concerning metaplastic changes in the larynx.
